Class LadderAndSnake

java.lang.Object
LadderAndSnake
public class LadderAndSnake extends Object
Author:
Fouad Meida and Rami Al Najem The LadderAndSnake class implements methods to play Ladder And Snakes game. Due date: February 6th, 2023

  • Constructor Details

    • LadderAndSnake

      public LadderAndSnake(int numPlayers)
      Parameters:
      numPlayers - constructor which takes numPlayers as a parameter and evaluates if the user inputs two users, less or more. Display the correct message for every case, set players array length to 2, initialize the on attribute to true and creates a random object with the dice attribute as a reference.

  • Method Details

    • getPlayers

      public Players[] getPlayers()
      Returns:
      the array of two players into the driver (PlayLadderAndSnake class).

    • getOn

      public boolean getOn()
      Returns:
      the boolean value of on because it will be used in the while loop in the driver (PlayLadderAndSnake class).

    • initializeBoard

      public void initializeBoard()
      This method initializes game's board so each square gets a value from 1 to 110.

    • setNameOfPlayers

      public void setNameOfPlayers()
      This method sets the name of every player in the game.

    • flipDice

      public int flipDice()
      This method
      Returns:
      an random integer value from 1 to 6. The dice value will be used later to add it to the previous square position of a player to get a new square position.

    • playersTurn

      public void playersTurn()
      This method decides which player should start first. Every player will roll the dice using flipDice() method and sets the number of attempts to 1. A player has the priority to start the game if he gets a higher dice value against the other player.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      A method which allow the user to start the game.

    • play

      public void play(Players p)
      Parameters:
      p - A method which takes a p parameter. The player will flip the dice, then the new position will be set. The new position of the player will be evaluated if it equals to 100, has a higher value than 100, has a value that is the bottom of a ladder, has a value that is the head of a snake, and if its position equals to the opposite player's position.
